column4: its really annoying when a program terminates using curses terminates with an unhandled exception. can i make python kill curses before doing this so it leaves me with a usable terminal?

No, because what happens there is curses doesn't re-set the terminal to a "happy" state as far as echo/etc is concerned (so its usable by a human), killing it early still won't make it reset that, your best bet is to restart the program, close it and let it shutdown properly
kdesudo worked for him. maybe kdesu has been replaced in kde 4.2 with kdesudo?
